title: Friday afternoon news briefing: UK and EU to enter 'tunnel negotiations' on Brexit deal after EU 27 give 'green light'
text:
PS - Taxpayers are throwing around accusations they have been "hung out to dry". Why are they in a spin? It appears they have been rinsed by John Bercow, after they paid a £490 bill for a new washing machine in his nanny's flat.

Man arrested after multiple stabbings in shopping centre

A man held after three people were stabbed at the Arndale Centre in Manchester has been arrested on suspicion of terror offences, police have said. Counter-terror police are investigating after an attacker was said to be lunging at people at random. Witnesses described scenes of chaos as a large number of police and emergency services descended on the area just before lunchtime. One video showed officers deploying a Taser to detain a suspect who was face down on the ground. Witnesses described how "everyone was panicking and frantic" as events unfolded. Full details, videos and pictures from the scene here.

Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed wins Nobel Peace Prize

The Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has won the Nobel Peace Prize for ending a 20-year conflict with Eritrea. He beat teenage climate change activist Greta Thunberg, native Brazilian leader Raoni Metuktire and the New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who were tipped as potential winners. Shortlists are not published, but all three were understood to be in the running. Africa Correspondent Adrian Blomfield explains how the Nobel Committee's decision marks a return to tradition in a must-read profile of Mr Ahmed.

News digest

Video: Ireland players lift strips of turf off ground

Concerns have been raised over the state of the pitch for Ireland's final Pool A clash against Samoa in Fukuoka tomorrow, with players seen lifting strips of it completely off the ground during today's captain's run. Ireland were conciliatory in their press conference this morning, with assistant coach Greg Feek saying he "did not want to cause any more controversy at this stage" when asked about the pitch. But the players' and coaches' faces were clear enough. Read on for details.
